A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I found this movie overall really enjoyable. It is a character development movie\, that's the ourpose it serves\, maybe that's why I enjoyed it. I'm all for watching hours of character build up\, but I do realize it's flaws. The way they presented some character growth and the way they chose to show maturity in a certain character lead to unnecessary storyline that ended being useless\, except for adding maybe one thing the main plot. Snoke was an Underwhelming villain which had a too simple defeat\, Phasma was a character with lost potential\, Luke had his out-of-character moments. Ben Solo/Kylo Ren is a fry villain\, and that was emphasized in this film; I find his character much more interesting with this character trait. There is a\, current\, balance with Rey and Ben being equally matched in their connection with the force. I found this film to be fun and enjoyable overall. It is a movie that I will rewatch\, but it still left the audience with previous and new questions\, all which will hopefully resolve themselves in Episode IX. Another plus: Poe is Leia's pseudo-son_Another con: There will be negative wtf moments.
